评论详情: Ordered these jeans, the description stated 100% cotton.  Color: Jacksboro.  However, like so many jeans today, these are not 100% cotton. They are 99% cotton, 1% elastane. I purposely do not buy stretch jeans, as they stretch out, and do not wear as well. Absolutely an inferior product to 100% cotton.Side note,  why bother stating these jeans are either  Made in USA or Imported.  That tells the buyer nothing.  These were actually made in Bangladesh. Please give accurate descriptions.I won’t be buying Wrangler again.

Bought three pair and every single one started to split in the rear.  Poor quality fabric is coming apart by the rivet on the rear pocket.  Did not even get three wash/wear cycles out of them.  They are not tight and are fairly relaxed fitting.  One pair is a fluke, two pair is an issue, three pair with the same problem is just extremely poor quality control.
Like other purchasers I have bought four pairs - all of them have ripped in back right pocket within a couple of months.  Disappointed given the price and that overall I really liked the fit.

评论概述: Best looking jeans with worst design flaw
评论详情: These were immediately my favorite jeans of all time (Dark Knight color). The color had an almost green undertone, the zipper hem was lime green, the pockets black, and the rear pocket logos looked awesome. They draped nicely over a thin build. I was suspicious of the thin fabric from the beginning, though. Thought, well they are Wrangler, a brand I always found to be rugged 5 or 10 year jeans. I remember getting low to pick up a tool and heard a tear. I couldn't pinpoint where. Considered it was just them getting worn in. One day, I was putting a receipt in my back pocket and heard a loud rip. That's right, a gentle placing a piece of paper in my pocket ripped the jeans. I am a slender fellow so it's not like my body was stressing out these jeans. It is too bad, as the design is the coolest. I checked on Amazon, and sure enough i3ts the same design flaw people are reporting and apparently it's a huge one..."rip resistance". Saw pictures of the same buttons ripping in the back. I even noticed the material back there thinned out to almost paper towel levels of thickness from, I guess, sitting down? Why Wrangler?! These jeans were one of a kind unique and awesome, and you used the cheapest material ever? I would have paid $20 more for true wrangler ruggedness with this sweet design!! Boo!
Fit true to size. Nice jeans.

Thee jeans claim to be 100% cotton. They stretch like a cheap pair of sweat pants. I can stretch the waist 4" minimum. I would need to buy 28" waist to keep these up. No where in the description does the word stretch apppear and 100% cotton doesn't stretch.
Great jeans only ones I’ll wear

This is my 4th purchase of these jeans. They hold up well wash after wash and aren't too stiff or too loose - perfect for everyday work or play. I have these in multiple colors, light and dark, and the sizing is consistent.
Returned : These Wrangler Retro jeans are an extremely thin fabric and, although touted as slim fit, are just slightly less baggy than the regular fit wrangler jean.

These jeans are ridiculously poor quality. They will develop holes in the exact same place. As expected, they're imported from Asia. The quality is absolutely atrocious even for that. Right off the bat, one of the five pairs I ordered was completely smaller than the others despite being labeled the same. After a few months (1-2 maybe) they developed tears in the upper inside corner of the back pockets (usually the right) where the metal attaches it to the jeans. They also developed tears where the back left belt loop attaches to the jeans.  I reached out to customer service a bit past the 1 year warranty date once the fourth pair of jeans developed it's second tear, and I was told there was nothing the could do. I'm just left with torn defective pants that were extremely overpriced. Bottoming, do not buy from this absolute joke of a company. They completely lost any quality they had from their history as an American company.
These are too baggy to be slim-fit jeans. Was disappointed.

评论概述: Stylish, Comfortable, and Built to Last!
评论详情: The Wrangler Men’s Retro Slim Fit Straight Leg Jeans are everything I want in a pair of jeans. The retro style gives them a timeless, rugged look, and the slim fit is flattering without being restrictive. The denim feels durable but soft, and they broke in beautifully after just a couple of wears. They’re perfect for casual outings or dressing up with boots and a button-down shirt. The fit and quality are spot on, and they’ve quickly become a staple in my wardrobe. Highly recommend for anyone looking for jeans that combine style, comfort, and toughness!
I gifted these for Christmas only for the recipient to find a hole by the pocket before wearing.  Super disaapointed as they were a gift.
3rd time I’m ordering this jeans and still doesn’t fit. Going back to Levi’s… Why is 31/32 way shorter than 32/32???

What a great fit....I LIKE THEM A LOT---So much I WILL ORDER THEM AGAIN!!!!!!!

Ordered 3 pairs and have barely worn them, and one pair already ripped near the back pocket. Now I’m a lot less confident about wearing these pants as I feel they could rip open at any time for no reason.  Love the availability of tall sizes, and color options. Hopefully the torn pair is a fluke. I have cheap Costco pants that have endured years of abuse as landscaping work pants but these Wranglers haven’t even been challenged yet.  Edit : I bought these thinking I was finally buying some tough AND good looking jeans, but they are not tough. I wore them to work a couple times and ripped the knee already. My other pants have endured 100x the same abuse. The wranglers are nice for fashion, but are not durable.

I’m pretty hard on my clothes, and I expect when I buy certain brands they will be durable and last me a long time. These Wranglers DO NOT fit that description. Within three months the back pocket is starting to tear which is completely unacceptable.

评论概述: Waist fit is larger and stretchy!
评论详情: This review is specific to the Wrangler Men’s SLIM fit jeans. I normally wear size 32 x 32 in any pants. It has been an ordeal getting the right fit with these jeans because the waist is stretchy.  32 waist for these was way too loose. I am SLIM, not a guy who has a pot belly or someone who likes to wear their pants like a gansta falling off them or the “plumber showing the crack”. I sent back the 32 x 32 pair and ordered 31 x 32. Even that is loose - a belt is required.  Know this before you order and that, like me, you’ll be continually pulling up these jeans if you don’t wear a belt.  Moral of the story I guess is if you want to be sure of what you’re buying go to a store and try on the jeans. I’m wondering why Wrangler named these “retro”.  I don’t remember jeans back in the day having a stretchy waist. Update: I did an exchange - 31 waist arrived and still a full inch too big.  Something wrong here.  Wrangler needs to do better quality control!  Amazon you may forward this to Wrangler.

I bought these Wrangler Retro Slim Straight Jeans because the description clearly stated they were denim. However, what I received was a pair of very thin twill pants that are nothing even close to denim. The material is flimsy, offering none of the durability or structure you expect from denim jeans. If you’re looking for sturdy, classic jeans, the black color are not it. Very disappointed and returning them immediately. Wrangler needs to fix their product descriptions on Amazon!

评论用户: Mike-pA. I have purchased 3 pairs at different times on Amazon. I don’t use them for work, just normal wear. All 3 pairs have ripped at the back pockets. I don’t wear them tight. Having them repaired costs 1/3 the price. Not worth it.

评论概述: Just like the $60 pair from the brick and mortar store down the street
评论详情: Just received these . I ordered the exact same color size and style that I had purchased locally from a sporting goods store for $59.99 plus tax. These (after tax) were a little less than half of what I paid. They are identical, right down to the stitching and “W” booty badges. I see reviews for these that claim they are knockoffs because they aren’t made like a battleship. These are really dress jeans. I think these are designed as “dancing denim “, not work pants. Just my $0.02. These run true to size. No need to buy bigger and shrink them to fit. I always wash mine for the first time inside out and these are no exception. Mine are 36x32 slim straight as I wear lace up boots (Irish Setters). If you wear cowboy boots, you may want to get the boot cut . I have had them as well for my HH boots. 🎤 drop

评论概述: Long Term Use Follow Up - Cannot Count On Them
评论详情: I say long term, but less than a year with jeans is not long term. These are my favorite go-to jeans period, Wrangler Retro Slim Straight. However, I have had 4 pairs split on me. I have never in my 50+ years had a pair of jeans split on my other than wearing through the knww.  The rear pocket rivets at the upper inside corner have some sort of design issue.  I reached out to Wrangle and sent them photos of two pairs ripped at the same rivet. I am slender, not overweight. I do not do labor work in these jeans. Wranger only replied with a return authorization. I had to pack them up and ship them to Wranger to be evaluated. Then they would determine if they would replace. The did replace them, but when I tried to communicate with them, they only wanted to solve the probllem by replacing them. They seemed to have zero interest in the fact that the issue was the same on multiple pairs and that I even showed them where many online complaints were of the exact same issue of jeans ripping from the upper inside picket rivet.  So Wrangler seems to care nothing about fixing the problem so that I can feel confident in purchasing these again in the future. That is what I want...fixe the problem so I can keep buying my favorite jeans.  By the way....one of the pairs Wrangler sent me as a replacement, failed even quicker, less than 2 months, in the exact same place.  So how can I keep buying these???...I cannot until Wrangler proves to me they fixed the problem and are not just willing to replace after I ship them for evaluation at my own expense and time.

评论概述: MAJOR DEFECT!! - Joining the Chorus of Ripped Jeans
评论详情: Wrangler, you have a major defect on your hands and you need to resolve it immediately.  I have one pair that I only wear for going out on casual event; nothing stressful.  They seen fine for that.  However, I bought a pair a few weeks ago and wore them to work, big mistake.  I work in a warehouse that requires a lot of bending, stooping, climbing, and carrying heavy stuff.  I normally wear the Wrangler Authentics because of the price and how badly I beat them up.  But Amazon had this item on sale, close to what the Authentics are priced so I bought them thinking they were a better quality product.  I wore them twice…twice and the right rear pocket, right at the brad, like some others have posted here, ripped about two inches.  So into the bin they went.Now I don’t know what is going on at Wragler.  I’ve noticed that while their prices are remaining somewhat consistent, their pockets and zipper have shrunk.  My hand barely fits in them and my Pro-Max phone sticks out and is uncomfortable to carry.  And I’m not going to discuss the torture the front zipper presents at certain times.  However, on their Authentics, the pockets are deep and the zippers are sufficiently accommodating.BUYER BEWARE! Do not buy these jeans if you plan on doing any cowboy…stuff or anything remotely close it it.  These are not the jeans for that.  Believe me, you will regret it.

The overdyed black are not jeans, they are chinos with external pockets. Not denim and probably won’t hold up. Bought plenty of the other Wrangler Retros and was happy with them. Not sure how I feel about the fabric these are made of. Tag says 98% cotton but feels more like poly blend.
They have just enough stretch for a waist line that cannot decide from one week to the next if it identifies as 33 or 34.
I have had these jeans for 2 months and they have already ripped in the seat. I have worn Wranglers for years and they normally last years but these are very poorly made

评论详情: Bought multiple pairs of these so called 100% cotton jeans for work. Not a single pair has made it through 2 months, purchased in August 2024 and it is October 2024 now all have ripped out at the right hand rear pocket on the inside of the pocket. Very disappointed in this product. Below is a review that wasn't there when we ordered these or we would not have ordered any of them. I will say Wrangler should be disappointed in this product, I assure you we are very disappointed in them. If Amazon and/or Wrangler would like to make this right with us we would appreciate it. Hope to here from someone very soon.  "Amazon has these listed wrong, they are NOT 100% cotton. These jeans are 99% cotton and 1% spandex. Completely miss leading. Sending these stretchy jeans back. May never order Wranglers again. Amazon star rating is misleading, it must be a generic gathering of information."

I used to love Wrangler jeans, if anything for their quality. No more. I've gone through more pairs in the last couple of  years due to tears at seams, buttons, and just random spots in the material - all while wearing appropriately fitted size, under normal use, and with recommended care. Most I can count on now is a few months of use before useless. Last Wranglers I'll purchase. There's a few good quality brands that I've tried out and sticking with. Yes, more expensive - but they're reliable and AMERICAN MADE.

I’m responding to express my disappointment in my Wrangler Retro jeans.  While they fit great and are extremely comfortable, they are the most horrible quality I’ve ever seen in jeans.  The rivets tear through the material on the back pockets and back pockets wear out and tear through the seat of the jeans after only a couple of wears and washings.  I have owned about 6 pair and every single one does the exact same thing.  I will not buy them again and will not recommend them.  It’s unfortunate that such nice looking jeans are so horribly made.
